text:
Betrayed Horror

Raskolnikov enters, burdened and weary.  
His eyes reveal deep sorrow.  
Raskolnikov: “Am I to come in or go away?”  
Dounia: “We waited for you all day.”  

---

Raskolnikov slumps in a chair, exhausted.  
Raskolnikov: “I feel weak, very tired.”  
Dounia: “Where were you all night?”  

---

Raskolnikov glances away, whispering.  
Raskolnikov: “I walked by the Neva… wanted to end it.”  
Dounia: “Thank God you still have faith!”  

---

Raskolnikov forces a bitter smile.  
Raskolnikov: “I’ve wept in mother’s arms… no faith.”  
Dounia: “You told her? Please say no!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov expresses his exhaustion and inner turmoil to his sister Dounia, revealing his struggle with despair and the contemplation of ending his life.
